name: Salt Lake City
fun_fact: Fun fact: Utah has its own unique food culture including 'fry sauce' (mayo-ketchup mixture invented here in 1948), funeral potatoes (cheesy potato casserole served at every Mormon gathering), and green Jell-O - Utah consumes more Jell-O per capita than any other state!

hero_dishes.name: Funeral Potatoes
hero_dishes.description: Creamy, cheesy hash brown casserole topped with cornflakes or crushed chips
hero_dishes.origin_story: A Mormon potluck staple served at funerals, church dinners, and family gatherings. So iconic that the 2002 Winter Olympics sold souvenir pins featuring the dish
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Chuck-A-Rama, Sizzler, any potluck in Utah, Marie Callender's

hero_dishes.name: Pastrami Burger
hero_dishes.description: Burger topped with pastrami, Swiss cheese, and Thousand Island dressing
hero_dishes.origin_story: A Utah original created at Crown Burgers by Greek immigrants - now found throughout the state
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Crown Burgers (the original), Apollo Burger, Lucky 13

hero_dishes.name: Fry Sauce
hero_dishes.description: Pink sauce made from mayonnaise and ketchup, Utah's essential condiment
hero_dishes.origin_story: Invented in 1948 at Arctic Circle drive-in in Salt Lake City. Utahns put it on everything
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Literally every fast food restaurant in Utah, Arctic Circle

hero_dishes.name: Scones (Utah-style)
hero_dishes.description: Fried dough served with honey butter - NOT the British baked variety
hero_dishes.origin_story: Mormon pioneer food - deep-fried and topped with honey butter or jam
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Sill's Cafe, Chuck-A-Rama, traditional Utah diners

signature_drinks.name: Dirty Soda
signature_drinks.description: Soda mixed with cream, flavored syrups, and sometimes lime - a Utah phenomenon
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At 'soda shops' like Swig or Sodalicious - Utah's answer to coffee culture due to LDS dietary guidelines

signature_drinks.name: Utah Craft Beer
signature_drinks.description: Despite stereotypes, SLC has an excellent craft beer scene
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At breweries like Epic, Uinta, and Squatters - beer laws have loosened significantly

food_culture_notes: LDS (Mormon) influence means unique food traditions and less alcohol focus
Greek and Pacific Islander communities contribute excellent cuisine
Farm-to-table movement strong with nearby farms and ranches
Outdoor culture means hearty, portable food for skiing and hiking
